alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:20PM EST until January 31 at 11:17AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Monroe, Jones, Twiggs and Bibb Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Macon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.3 feet, Minor flooding continues along the river upstream and downstream from the gage at U.S. Highway 80 or Martin Luther King Boulevard. Portions of the Ocmulgee Riverwalk and agricultural lands well downstream will be under a foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Sunday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EST Sunday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.0 feet on 07/09/1896. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 830 AM EST.
